psychologists during late th century originally studied philosophy M nsterberg had many interests in field psychology such as purposive psychology social psychology forensic psychology In he wrote several magazine articles concerning legal aspects testimony confessions courtroom procedures which eventually developed into his book On Witness Stand following year Division Applied Psychology was adjoined Harvard Psychological Laboratory Within years he had contributed eight books in English applying psychology education industrial efficiency business teaching Eventually Hugo M nsterberg his contributions would define him as creator applied psychology In International Association Applied Psychology IAAP was founded as first international scholarly society within field psychology Most Sport psychology specialization within psychology that seeks understand psychological mental factors that affect performance in sports physical activity exercise apply these enhance individual team performance sport psychology approach differs from coaches players perspective Coaches tend narrow focus energy towards end goal They are concerned with actions that lead win as opposed sport psychologist tries focus players thoughts on just achieving win Sport psychology trains players mentally prepare them whereas coaches tend focus mostly on physical training Sport psychology deals with increasing performance by managing emotions minimizing psychological effects injury poor performance Some most important skills taught are goal setting relaxation visualization self talk awareness control concentration using rituals attribution training periodization principles theories may be applied any human movement performance tasks e g playing musical instrument acting in play public speaking motor skills Usually experts recommend that students be trained in both kinesiology i e sport exercise sciences physical education counseling Traffic psychology edit Traffic psychology an
